<body bgcolor="#CCCCCC" background="../../teach/classes/background.gif"
lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=WordSection1>

<h2><span class=SpellE><span style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>CompSci</span></span><span
style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'> (CS) 171 — Introduction to Artificial
Intelligence — <span class=GramE>Fall</span> 2012</span><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>Current Announcements: <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The answer key to the Final Exam is now posted
below and <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>A prototype C++ Tournament shell has been
released.  It is available at the following code repository: <br>
<a href="https://github.com/Hydrotoast/ConnectK">https://github.com/Hydrotoast/ConnectK</a>
<br>
<span class=GramE>Normally</span> I protect student privacy very carefully, but
this student has volunteered to make his email address publicly available: <br>
<a href="mailto:gborje@uci.edu">gborje@uci.edu</a> <br>
so that you can contact him directly with issues and observations, bugs and bug
fixes (if you contact him, please note that his name is <span class=SpellE>Gio</span>).</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>A prototype Java Tournament shell has been
released.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Normally I protect
student privacy very carefully, but this student has volunteered to make the
code link on his home page publicly available: <br>
<a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eavanbusk/connectK/">http://www.ics.uci.edu/~avanbusk/connectK/</a>
<br>
so that update files can be propagated immediately.  He also has
volunteered to make his email address publicly available: <br>
<a href="mailto:avanbusk@uci.edu">avanbusk@uci.edu</a> <br>
so that you can contact him directly with issues and observations, bugs and bug
fixes (if you contact him, please note that his name is Alex).</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The due date for the Project and the Tournament
is Friday midnight, 7 December.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The answer key to CS-171 Quiz #4 is now posted
below and <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>A detailed grading rubric for the Connect-K
programming project has been inserted into the Project Specification and is
available below and <a
href="../projects/connect-k/Connect-K-project-specification.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The answer key to CS-171 Quiz #3 is now posted
below and <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The answer key to CS-171 Mid-term Exam is now
posted below and <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs171-old-tests/2012-fq-cs-171-midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>A Project Specification for the Connect-K
programming project is available <a
href="../projects/connect-k/Connect-K-project-specification.pdf">here</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A detailed grading rubric will be
released shortly.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>My office hours on Thursday, 1 November, will end
at 1:30pm in order to attend the lecture by Dr. <span class=SpellE>Waleed</span>
<span class=SpellE>Abdalati</span>, Chief Scientist, <span class=GramE>NASA,
sponsored by the UCI Office of Research (<a
href="Waleed-Abdalati-chief-scientist-nasa.pdf">see announcement</a></span>).</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The answer key to CS-171 Quiz #2 is now posted
below.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>The answer key to CS-171 Quiz #1 is now posted
below.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>There are now<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>two CS-171 <span class=SpellE>MessageBoard</span>
forums at EEE:</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle>(1) Class Discussion; and</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle>(2) Seeking project programming team
partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>(Please use this forum if
you are seeking a programming team partner for the class project.)</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>You are *required* to form project teams of two
students, following the “<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm. It is not possible to have one-person project teams.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>As stated in lecture and on the class website,
the textbook is required.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You will
be at a serious disadvantage for quizzes and exams if you do not have the
textbook as a study aid. Please be sure you have Russell & <span
class=SpellE>Norvig</span>, 3rd ed. (the blue one).</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Current
announcements will appear here, at top-level, for quick and easy inspection.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Lecture:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Place: <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/HH178.html">HH 178</a> (In the basement
of <a href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/HH.html">Building 601</a> on the <a
href="http://today.uci.edu/pdf/UCI_10_map_campus_core.pdf">UCI campus map</a><span
class=GramE>)</span><br>
Time: Tuesday/Thursday 11:00am-12:20pm<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Discussion sections:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Dis 1: Monday 2:00-2:50pm in <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/MSTB118.html">MSTB 118</a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Dis 2: Monday 3:00-3:50pm in <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/ELH110.html">ELH 110</a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Instructor: Richard Lathrop <br>
Office hours: Tuesday/Thursday 1:00-2:20pm, or anytime by appointment, in
DBH-4224<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Email:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="mailto:rickl@uci.edu?subject=CS-171:%20%3cplease%20edit%20subject%3e">rickl@uci.edu</a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;

put “CS-171” somewhere in the Subject line.)<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every second Thursday, the first 20
minutes will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook
reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly
material presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that many
students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include some questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project, in which you will be provided with a
“dumb” GUI shell, for which you will be required to code the
“smarts.”<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are <span
style='color:red'>required</span> to form teams of two students, following the
“<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are
encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are
forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for class materials provided from
this class website, you must invent and write all of your own code by yourself
with your partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for
properly referenced material, you must write all of your project report by
yourself with your partner. Please note that your source code and project
report are subject to analysis by automated plagiarism detection programs, and
that direct copying will be treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please
see the section on “<a href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>”
below).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Russell & <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You
place yourself at a distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of
trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition is required.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>R&N
estimates that about 20% of the material in the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition is new
from the 2<sup>nd</sup> edition.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Several of the chapters and exercises have been rearranged.</span><strong>
</strong><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(</b>A kind and helpful student
has elucidated some of the differences between the 2<sup>nd</sup> & 3<sup>rd</sup>
editions; <a href="../differencesEd3vsEd2.pdf">click here</a>.)<span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves will always be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook.</span></b><strong><span
style='color:red;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do
deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>You are likely to find the book cheaper if you search online at
EBay.com, Amazon.com, and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A student
kindly contributed the following suggestion, for which I cannot vouch, and
which I provide for your use if it is useful to you:<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<br>
I just wanted to point out that there does <span class=GramE>exist</span> an

Obviously, it is in paperback. <br>
<br>
<a href="http://www.valorebooks.com/affiliate/buy/siteID=e79mzf/ISBN=0136042597">http://www.valorebooks.com/affiliate/buy/siteID=e79mzf/ISBN=0136042597</a>
<br>

<h2><a name="_Grading:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Grading:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
grade will be based on the bi-weekly </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>quizzes
(20%), a project (20%), a mid-term exam (25%), and a final exam (35%).</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Homework is assigned but ungraded.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Quizzes will be given the first 20 minutes of class every
second Thursday (starting the third Thursday, and adjusted for the mid-term
exam).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your lowest quiz score will
be discarded in computing your grade.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>It is not possible to make-up missed quizzes, but one missed quiz may be
discarded as your lowest quiz score.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The mid-term exam will be given in class on Tuesday,
November 6, and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up a missed
mid-term exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The final exam will be given on Tuesday, December 11, 10:30
- 12:30 p.m., 10:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m., and is closed-book, closed-notes.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The final exam will cover all course
material from the entire quarter, but mostly the second half.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It is not possible to make-up a missed
final exam.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Dates
and times for all final exams are set by the UCI Registrar (<a
href="http://www.reg.uci.edu/calendars/finals/schedule-201213.html">Final Exam
Schedule 2012-13</a>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>I make exceptions for genuine medical conditions (I require
a note from your doctor on official letterhead) or deaths in the family (I
require a copy of the death certificate).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Also, I honor all requests made by the UCI Disability Services Center.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo5'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Every student who fills out a course evaluation
for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and
clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>EEE will
return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the
content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final
grade of each such named student.</span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Student
course evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and improving the
course content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our success at our
educational mission.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>*Please* fill
out your student course evaluations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Syllabus:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Syllabus:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><b>The following represents a preliminary syllabus. Some changes in the lecture

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><a
href="../projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/FullExecutable/Connect.exe"><span
class=GramE>Connect-K Game</span></a><span class=GramE>.</span></span></b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This project corresponds to Game Search
(Chapter 5 in your book). Your job is to write an AI agent that can beat you at
Connect-K, i.e., to write the adversarial search (“game search”)
controller for a video game world.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>A Project Specification for the Connect-K programming project is
available <a href="../projects/connect-k/Connect-K-project-specification.pdf">here</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A detailed grading rubric has been
released as part of the Project Specification.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><a href="../projects/connect-k/connectgame/symvc">A Java shell is
available</a>; <a href="../projects/connect-k/connectgame/vcpp">a C++ shell is
available</a>; <a
href="../projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/SampleExecutable/SampleConnect.exe">an
example “dumb” game is available</a>; <a
href="../projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/FullExecutable/Connect.exe">an
example “smart” game is available</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span class=GramE>A student has kindly
contributed the Java packages for the term project game and put them together
into a jar file (<a href="../projects/connect-k/sfc.jar">available here</a>).</span>
Another student has kindly written a Java application for use with the term
project game, from scratch, using Swing (<a href="../projects/connect-k/src.zip">available
here</a>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>A prototype C++ Tournament shell has been released. 
It is available at the following code repository: <br>
<a href="https://github.com/Hydrotoast/ConnectK">https://github.com/Hydrotoast/ConnectK</a>
<br>
<span class=GramE>Normally</span> I protect student privacy very carefully, but
this student has volunteered to make his email address publicly available: <br>
<a href="mailto:gborje@uci.edu">gborje@uci.edu</a> <br>
so that you can contact him directly with issues and observations, bugs and bug
fixes (if you contact him, please note that his name is <span class=SpellE>Gio</span>).</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>A prototype Java Tournament shell has been
released.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Normally I protect
student privacy very carefully, but this student has volunteered to make the
code link on his home page publicly available: <br>
<a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eavanbusk/connectK/">http://www.ics.uci.edu/~avanbusk/connectK/</a>
<br>
so that update files can be propagated immediately.  He also has
volunteered to make his email address publicly available: <br>
<a href="mailto:avanbusk@uci.edu">avanbusk@uci.edu</a> <br>
so that you can contact him directly with issues and observations, bugs and bug
fixes (if you contact him, please note that his name is Alex).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>There is also a “tournament” shell that was begun by the
undergraduate working on the Game code (<a
href="../projects/connect-k/TournamentFINAL">available here</a>), but he
graduated before it was finished.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Another tournament small framework, written by another student, is <a
href="../projects/connect-k/Tournament_small_framework">available here</a>, and
as a zip file <a href="../projects/connect-k/Tournament_small_framework.zip">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>I will offer extra credit to any students who are interested in playing a
“tournament” and get that code working.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will also offer CS-199 credit to any
student who wishes to do this as an independent study in the future (grade of
A- or better required).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>All of my various CS-171 projects were written by former CS-171 students
who became interested in AI and signed up for CS-199 in order to pursue their
interest and write interesting AI project shells.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please let me know if this is of
interest to you (grade of A- or better required).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

Mid-term, and Final exams:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;color:red'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous
CS-171 Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study

incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;font-weight:normal;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable and will not be
tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the responsibility of
each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic honesty policies.
Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://www.senate.uci.edu/senateweb/default2.asp?active_page_id=754">UCI
Senate Academic Honesty Policies</a> and the <a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/index.php#cheating">ICS School
policy on cheating</a>.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p>The policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student
who engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion
in dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students. </p>
